review: Needs Ethernet integration to work reliably.  Less than perfect wireless reception makes it very choppy.  Using your smartphone as a remote is a lot less convenient than it sounds, especially with an android phone (and you would think it would be more seamless with Google's mobile OS).  The software and content availability are pretty amazing, though.  Can't say how it compares to Roku or Apple TV, but it is FAR superior to "Smart" TV or DVD player software.

review: Google Chrome cast works well enough, but it is still horribly slow. At least mine is.1. When using it on my iPhone, it often disconnects from my phone and continues to play just off my wi-fi​. This is fine, but it takes my phone a long time to reconnect after it disconnects, making it hard to adjust any settings. Sometimes I have to completely close out Netflix or whatever application is running and re-open it to get it to connect.2. When using in my computer it makes chrome run meticulously slow. I can't stand it and just don't use it. In fairness, my computer is a few years old, but I can run pretty large programs without problems.Overall - It is a great device/idea, but it just isn't polished enough yet. Roku is a better option in my opinion. I haven't tried the kindle stick, but it may also be better.
